member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AccessConfiguration
member.summary: Access configuration parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AccessConfiguration.AccessType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessType.
The type of authentication used to access content from HttpConfiguration::BaseUrl on your source location. Accepted value: S3_SIGV4.
S3_SIGV4 - AWS Signature Version 4 authentication for Amazon S3 hosted virtual-style access. If your source location base URL is an Amazon S3 bucket, MediaTailor can use AWS Signature Version 4 (SigV4) authentication to access the bucket where your source content is stored. Your MediaTailor source location baseURL must follow the S3 virtual hosted-style request URL format. For example, https://bucket-name.s3.Region.amazonaws.com/key-name.
Before you can use S3_SIGV4, you must meet these requirements:
• You must allow MediaTailor to access your S3 bucket by granting mediatailor.amazonaws.com principal access in IAM. For information about configuring access in IAM, see Access management in the IAM User Guide.
• The mediatailor.amazonaws.com service principal must have permissions to read all top level manifests referenced by the VodSource packaging configurations.
• The caller of the API must have s3:GetObject IAM permissions to read all top level manifests referenced by your MediaTailor VodSource packaging configurations.

member.summary:

How long (in milliseconds) after the beginning of the program that an ad starts. This value must fall within 100ms of a segment boundary, otherwise the ad break will be skipped.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AdBreak.SpliceInsertMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpliceInsertMessage.
This defines the SCTE-35 splice_insert() message inserted around the ad. For information about using splice_insert(), see the SCTE-35 specficiaiton, section 9.7.3.1.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AdMarkerPassthrough
member.summary:
For HLS, when set to true, MediaTailor passes through EXT-X-CUE-IN, EXT-X-CUE-OUT, and EXT-X-SPLICEPOINT-SCTE35 ad markers from the origin manifest to the MediaTailor personalized manifest.
No logic is applied to these ad markers. For example, if EXT-X-CUE-OUT has a value of 60, but no ads are filled for that ad break, MediaTailor will not set the value to 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AdMarkerPassthrough.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enabled.
Enables ad marker passthrough for your configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailMatchingCriteria
member.summary:
MediaTailor only places (consumes) prefetched ads if the ad break meets the criteria defined by the dynamic variables. This gives you granular control over which ad break to place the prefetched ads into.
As an example, let's say that you set DynamicVariable to scte.event_id and Operator to EQUALS, and your playback configuration has an ADS URL of https://my.ads.server.com/path?&podId=[scte.avail_num]&event=[scte.event_id]&duration=[session.avail_duration_secs]. And the prefetch request to the ADS contains these values https://my.ads.server.com/path?&podId=3&event=my-awesome-event&duration=30. MediaTailor will only insert the prefetched ads into the ad break if has a SCTE marker with an event id of my-awesome-event, since it must match the event id that MediaTailor uses to query the ADS.
You can specify up to five AvailMatchingCriteria. If you specify multiple AvailMatchingCriteria, MediaTailor combines them to match using a logical AND. You can model logical OR combinations by creating multiple prefetch schedules.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailMatchingCriteria.DynamicVariable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DynamicVariable.
The dynamic variable(s) that MediaTailor should use as avail matching criteria. MediaTailor only places the prefetched ads into the avail if the avail matches the criteria defined by the dynamic variable. For information about dynamic variables, see Using dynamic ad variables in the MediaTailor User Guide.
You can include up to 100 dynamic variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailMatchingCriteria.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
For the DynamicVariable specified in AvailMatchingCriteria, the Operator that is used for the comparison.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailSuppression
member.summary: The configuration for avail suppression, also known as ad suppression. For more information about ad suppression, see Ad Suppression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailSuppression.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Sets the ad suppression mode. By default, ad suppression is off and all ad breaks are filled with ads or slate. When Mode is set to BEHIND_LIVE_EDGE, ad suppression is active and MediaTailor won't fill ad breaks on or behind the ad suppression Value time in the manifest lookback window.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.AvailSuppression.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
A live edge offset time in HH:MM:SS. MediaTailor won't fill ad breaks on or behind this time in the manifest lookback window. If Value is set to 00:00:00, it is in sync with the live edge, and MediaTailor won't fill any ad breaks on or behind the live edge. If you set a Value time, MediaTailor won't fill any ad breaks on or behind this time in the manifest lookback window. For example, if you set 00:45:00, then MediaTailor will fill ad breaks that occur within 45 minutes behind the live edge, but won't fill ad breaks on or behind 45 minutes behind the live edge.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CdnConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration for using a content delivery network (CDN), like Amazon CloudFront, for content and ad segment management.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CdnConfiguration.AdSegmentUrlPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdSegmentUrlPrefix.
A non-default content delivery network (CDN) to serve ad segments. By default, AWS Elemental MediaTailor uses Amazon CloudFront with default cache settings as its CDN for ad segments. To set up an alternate CDN, create a rule in your CDN for the origin ads.mediatailor.<region>.amazonaws.com. Then specify the rule's name in this AdSegmentUrlPrefix. When AWS Elemental MediaTailor serves a manifest, it reports your CDN as the source for ad segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CdnConfiguration.ContentSegmentUrlPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentSegmentUrlPrefix.
A content delivery network (CDN) to cache content segments, so that content requests don’t always have to go to the origin server. First, create a rule in your CDN for the content segment origin server. Then specify the rule's name in this ContentSegmentUrlPrefix. When AWS Elemental MediaTailor serves a manifest, it reports your CDN as the source for content segments.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ConfigureLogsForPlaybackConfiguration operation. Configures Amazon CloudWatch log settings for a playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ConfigureLogsForPlaybackConfigurationRequest.PercentEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentEnabled.
The percentage of session logs that MediaTailor sends to your Cloudwatch Logs account. For example, if your playback configuration has 1000 sessions and percentEnabled is set to 60, MediaTailor sends logs for 600 of the sessions to CloudWatch Logs. MediaTailor decides at random which of the playback configuration sessions to send logs for. If you want to view logs for a specific session, you can use the debug log mode.
Valid values: 0 - 100

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreatePrefetchSchedule operation. Creates a new prefetch schedule for the specified playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest.Consumption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Consumption.
The configuration settings for MediaTailor's consumption of the prefetched ads from the ad decision server. Each consumption configuration contains an end time and an optional start time that define the consumption window. Prefetch schedules automatically expire no earlier than seven days after the end time.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The identifier for the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest.PlaybackConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationName.
The name of the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest.Retrieval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Retrieval.
The configuration settings for retrieval of prefetched ads from the ad decision server. Only one set of prefetched ads will be retrieved and subsequently consumed for each ad break.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleRequest.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
An optional stream identifier that MediaTailor uses to prefetch ads for multiple streams that use the same playback configuration. If StreamId is specified, MediaTailor returns all of the prefetch schedules with an exact match on StreamId. If not specified, MediaTailor returns all of the prefetch schedules for the playback configuration, regardless of StreamId.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreatePrefetchSchedule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the prefetch schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.Consumption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Consumption.
Consumption settings determine how, and when, MediaTailor places the prefetched ads into ad breaks. Ad consumption occurs within a span of time that you define, called a consumption window. You can designate which ad breaks that MediaTailor fills with prefetch ads by setting avail matching criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the prefetch schedule. The name must be unique among all prefetch schedules that are associated with the specified playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.PlaybackConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationName.
The name of the playback configuration to create the prefetch schedule for.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.Retrieval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Retrieval.
A complex type that contains settings for prefetch retrieval from the ad decision server (ADS).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.CreatePrefetchScheduleResponse.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
An optional stream identifier that you can specify in order to prefetch for multiple streams that use the same playback configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration for DASH content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfiguration.ManifestEndpointPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestEndpointPrefix.
The URL generated by MediaTailor to initiate a playback session. The session uses server-side reporting. This setting is ignored in PUT operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfiguration.MpdLocation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MpdLocation.
The setting that controls whether MediaTailor includes the Location tag in DASH manifests. MediaTailor populates the Location tag with the URL for manifest update requests, to be used by players that don't support sticky redirects. Disable this if you have CDN routing rules set up for accessing MediaTailor manifests, and you are either using client-side reporting or your players support sticky HTTP redirects. Valid values are DISABLED and EMT_DEFAULT. The EMT_DEFAULT setting enables the inclusion of the tag and is the default value.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfiguration.OriginManifestType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OriginManifestType.
The setting that controls whether MediaTailor handles manifests from the origin server as multi-period manifests or single-period manifests. If your origin server produces single-period manifests, set this to SINGLE_PERIOD. The default setting is MULTI_PERIOD. For multi-period manifests, omit this setting or set it to MULTI_PERIOD.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfigurationForPut
member.summary: The configuration for DASH PUT operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfigurationForPut.MpdLocation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MpdLocation.
The setting that controls whether MediaTailor includes the Location tag in DASH manifests. MediaTailor populates the Location tag with the URL for manifest update requests, to be used by players that don't support sticky redirects. Disable this if you have CDN routing rules set up for accessing MediaTailor manifests, and you are either using client-side reporting or your players support sticky HTTP redirects. Valid values are DISABLED and EMT_DEFAULT. The EMT_DEFAULT setting enables the inclusion of the tag and is the default value.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashConfigurationForPut.OriginManifestType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OriginManifestType.
The setting that controls whether MediaTailor handles manifests from the origin server as multi-period manifests or single-period manifests. If your origin server produces single-period manifests, set this to SINGLE_PERIOD. The default setting is MULTI_PERIOD. For multi-period manifests, omit this setting or set it to MULTI_PERIOD.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashPlaylistSettings.MinBufferTimeSeconds
member.summary:

Minimum amount of content (measured in seconds) that a player must keep available in the buffer. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashPlaylistSettings.MinUpdatePeriodSeconds
member.summary:

Minimum amount of time (in seconds) that the player should wait before requesting updates to the manifest. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DashPlaylistSettings.SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds
member.summary:

Amount of time (in seconds) that the player should be from the live point at the end of the manifest. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DefaultSegmentDeliveryConfiguration
member.summary: The optional configuration for a server that serves segments. Use this if you want the segment delivery server to be different from the source location server. For example, you can configure your source location server to be an origination server, such as MediaPackage, and the segment delivery server to be a content delivery network (CDN), such as CloudFront. If you don't specify a segment delivery server, then the source location server is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DefaultSegmentDeliveryConfiguration.BaseUrl
member.summary:

The hostname of the server that will be used to serve segments. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.AdDecisionServerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdDecisionServerUrl.
The URL for the ad decision server (ADS). This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing, you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.AvailSuppression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailSuppression.
The configuration for avail suppression, also known as ad suppression. For more information about ad suppression, see Ad Suppression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.Bumper
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bumper.
The configuration for bumpers. Bumpers are short audio or video clips that play at the start or before the end of an ad break. To learn more about bumpers, see Bumpers.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestProcessingRules.
The configuration for manifest processing rules. Manifest processing rules enable customization of the personalized manifests created by MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The identifier for the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.PersonalizationThresholdSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PersonalizationThresholdSeconds.
Defines the maximum duration of underfilled ad time (in seconds) allowed in an ad break. If the duration of underfilled ad time exceeds the personalization threshold, then the personalization of the ad break is abandoned and the underlying content is shown. This feature applies to ad replacement in live and VOD streams, rather than ad insertion, because it relies on an underlying content stream. For more information about ad break behavior, including ad replacement and insertion, see Ad Behavior in AWS Elemental MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.PlaybackConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.PlaybackEndpointPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackEndpointPrefix.
The URL that the player accesses to get a manifest from AWS Elemental MediaTailor. This session will use server-side reporting.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.SessionInitializationEndpointPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionInitializationEndpointPrefix.
The URL that the player uses to initialize a session that uses client-side reporting.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.SlateAdUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlateAdUrl.
The URL for a high-quality video asset to transcode and use to fill in time that's not used by ads. AWS Elemental MediaTailor shows the slate to fill in gaps in media content. Configuring the slate is optional for non-VPAID playback configurations. For VPAID, the slate is required because MediaTailor provides it in the slots designated for dynamic ad content. The slate must be a high-quality asset that contains both audio and video.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags assigned to the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.TranscodeProfileName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TranscodeProfileName.
The name that is used to associate this playback configuration with a custom transcode profile. This overrides the dynamic transcoding defaults of MediaTailor. Use this only if you have already set up custom profiles with the help of AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPlaybackConfigurationResponse.VideoContentSourceUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VideoContentSourceUrl.
The URL prefix for the parent manifest for the stream, minus the asset ID. The maximum length is 512 characters.

The name of the playback configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetPrefetchSchedule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the prefetch schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.Consumption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Consumption.
Consumption settings determine how, and when, MediaTailor places the prefetched ads into ad breaks. Ad consumption occurs within a span of time that you define, called a consumption window. You can designate which ad breaks that MediaTailor fills with prefetch ads by setting avail matching criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the prefetch schedule. The name must be unique among all prefetch schedules that are associated with the specified playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.PlaybackConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationName.
The name of the playback configuration to create the prefetch schedule for.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.Retrieval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Retrieval.
A complex type that contains settings for prefetch retrieval from the ad decision server (ADS).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.GetPrefetchScheduleResponse.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
An optional stream identifier that you can specify in order to prefetch for multiple streams that use the same playback configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HlsConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration for HLS content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HlsConfiguration.ManifestEndpointPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestEndpointPrefix.
The URL that is used to initiate a playback session for devices that support Apple HLS. The session uses server-side reporting.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HlsPlaylistSettings
member.summary: HLS playlist configuration parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HlsPlaylistSettings.ManifestWindowSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestWindowSeconds.
The total duration (in seconds) of each manifest. Minimum value: 30 seconds. Maximum value: 3600 seconds.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpConfiguration
member.summary: The HTTP configuration for the source location.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpConfiguration.BaseUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BaseUrl.
The base URL for the source location host server. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpPackageConfiguration
member.summary: The HTTP package configuration properties for the requested VOD source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpPackageConfiguration.Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Path.
The relative path to the URL for this VOD source. This is combined with SourceLocation::HttpConfiguration::BaseUrl to form a valid URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpPackageConfiguration.SourceGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceGroup.
The name of the source group. This has to match one of the Channel::Outputs::SourceGroup.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.HttpPackageConfiguration.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The streaming protocol for this package configuration. Supported values are HLS and DASH.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListPlaybackConfigurations operation. Returns a list of the playback configurations defined in AWS Elemental MediaTailor. You can specify a maximum number of configurations to return at a time. The default maximum is 50. Results are returned in pagefuls. If MediaTailor has more configurations than the specified maximum, it provides parameters in the response that you can use to retrieve the next pageful.

member.summary:

Maximum number of records to return.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListPrefetchSchedules operation. Creates a new prefetch schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of prefetch schedules that you want MediaTailor to return in response to the current request. If the playback configuration has more than MaxResults prefetch schedules, use the value of NextToken in the response to get the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
(Optional) If the playback configuration has more than MaxResults prefetch schedules, use NextToken to get the second and subsequent pages of results.
For the first ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest request, omit this value.
For the second and subsequent requests, get the value of NextToken from the previous response and specify that value for NextToken in the request.
If the previous response didn't include a NextToken element, there are no more prefetch schedules to get.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest.PlaybackConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationName.
The name of the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
An optional filtering parameter whereby MediaTailor filters the prefetch schedules to include only specific streams.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListPrefetchSchedules operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesResponse.Items
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Items.
Lists the prefetch schedules. An empty Items list doesn't mean there aren't more items to fetch, just that that page was empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPrefetchSchedulesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The value that you will use forNextToken in the next ListPrefetchSchedulesRequest request.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.LivePreRollConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration for pre-roll ad insertion.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.LivePreRollConfiguration.AdDecisionServerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdDecisionServerUrl.
The URL for the ad decision server (ADS) for pre-roll ads. This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing, you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.LivePreRollConfiguration.MaxDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxDurationSeconds. The maximum allowed duration for the pre-roll ad avail. AWS Elemental MediaTailor won't play pre-roll ads to exceed this duration, regardless of the total duration of ads that the ADS returns.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.LogConfiguration
member.summary: Returns Amazon CloudWatch log settings for a playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.LogConfiguration.PercentEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentEnabled.
The percentage of session logs that MediaTailor sends to your Cloudwatch Logs account. For example, if your playback configuration has 1000 sessions and percentEnabled is set to 60, MediaTailor sends logs for 600 of the sessions to CloudWatch Logs. MediaTailor decides at random which of the playback configuration sessions to send logs for. If you want to view logs for a specific session, you can use the debug log mode.
Valid values: 0 - 100

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ManifestProcessingRules
member.summary: The configuration for manifest processing rules. Manifest processing rules enable customization of the personalized manifests created by MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ManifestProcessingRules.AdMarkerPassthrough
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdMarkerPassthrough.
For HLS, when set to true, MediaTailor passes through EXT-X-CUE-IN, EXT-X-CUE-OUT, and EXT-X-SPLICEPOINT-SCTE35 ad markers from the origin manifest to the MediaTailor personalized manifest.
No logic is applied to these ad markers. For example, if EXT-X-CUE-OUT has a value of 60, but no ads are filled for that ad break, MediaTailor will not set the value to 0.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration
member.summary: Creates a playback configuration. For information about MediaTailor configurations, see Working with configurations in AWS Elemental MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.AdDecisionServerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdDecisionServerUrl.
The URL for the ad decision server (ADS). This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.AvailSuppression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailSuppression.
The configuration for avail suppression, also known as ad suppression. For more information about ad suppression, see Ad Suppression.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.Bumper
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bumper.
The configuration for bumpers. Bumpers are short audio or video clips that play at the start or before the end of an ad break. To learn more about bumpers, see Bumpers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.CdnConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdnConfiguration.
The configuration for using a content delivery network (CDN), like Amazon CloudFront, for content and ad segment management.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.ConfigurationAliases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationAliases.
The player parameters and aliases used as dynamic variables during session initialization. For more information, see Domain Variables.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.DashConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DashConfiguration.
The configuration for a DASH source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.HlsConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HlsConfiguration.
The configuration for HLS content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.LivePreRollConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LivePreRollConfiguration.
The configuration for pre-roll ad insertion.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.LogConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogConfiguration.
The Amazon CloudWatch log settings for a playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.ManifestProcessingRules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestProcessingRules.
The configuration for manifest processing rules. Manifest processing rules enable customization of the personalized manifests created by MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The identifier for the playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.PersonalizationThresholdSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PersonalizationThresholdSeconds.
Defines the maximum duration of underfilled ad time (in seconds) allowed in an ad break. If the duration of underfilled ad time exceeds the personalization threshold, then the personalization of the ad break is abandoned and the underlying content is shown. This feature applies to ad replacement in live and VOD streams, rather than ad insertion, because it relies on an underlying content stream. For more information about ad break behavior, including ad replacement and insertion, see Ad Behavior in AWS Elemental MediaTailor.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlaybackConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the playback configuration.

member.summary:

The URL that the player accesses to get a manifest from AWS Elemental MediaTailor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.SessionInitializationEndpointPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionInitializationEndpointPrefix.
The URL that the player uses to initialize a session that uses client-side reporting.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.SlateAdUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlateAdUrl.
The URL for a video asset to transcode and use to fill in time that's not used by ads. AWS Elemental MediaTailor shows the slate to fill in gaps in media content. Configuring the slate is optional for non-VPAID playback configurations. For VPAID, the slate is required because MediaTailor provides it in the slots designated for dynamic ad content. The slate must be a high-quality asset that contains both audio and video.

member.summary:

The name that is used to associate this playback configuration with a custom transcode profile. This overrides the dynamic transcoding defaults of MediaTailor. Use this only if you have already set up custom profiles with the help of AWS Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration.VideoContentSourceUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VideoContentSourceUrl.
The URL prefix for the parent manifest for the stream, minus the asset ID. The maximum length is 512 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchConsumption
member.summary: A complex type that contains settings that determine how and when that MediaTailor places prefetched ads into upcoming ad breaks.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchConsumption.AvailMatchingCriteria
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailMatchingCriteria.
If you only want MediaTailor to insert prefetched ads into avails (ad breaks) that match specific dynamic variables, such as scte.event_id, set the avail matching criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchConsumption.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The time when MediaTailor no longer considers the prefetched ads for use in an ad break. MediaTailor automatically deletes prefetch schedules no less than seven days after the end time. If you'd like to manually delete the prefetch schedule, you can call DeletePrefetchSchedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchConsumption.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The time when prefetched ads are considered for use in an ad break. If you don't specify StartTime, the prefetched ads are available after MediaTailor retrives them from the ad decision server.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchRetrieval
member.summary: A complex type that contains settings governing when MediaTailor prefetches ads, and which dynamic variables that MediaTailor includes in the request to the ad decision server.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchRetrieval.DynamicVariables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DynamicVariables.
The dynamic variables to use for substitution during prefetch requests to the ad decision server (ADS).
You intially configure dynamic variables for the ADS URL when you set up your playback configuration. When you specify DynamicVariables for prefetch retrieval, MediaTailor includes the dynamic variables in the request to the ADS.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchRetrieval.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The time when prefetch retrieval ends for the ad break. Prefetching will be attempted for manifest requests that occur at or before this time.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchRetrieval.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The time when prefetch retrievals can start for this break. Ad prefetching will be attempted for manifest requests that occur at or after this time. Defaults to the current time. If not specified, the prefetch retrieval starts as soon as possible.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchSchedule
member.summary: A complex type that contains prefetch schedule information.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchSchedule.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the prefetch schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchSchedule.Consumption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Consumption.
Consumption settings determine how, and when, MediaTailor places the prefetched ads into ad breaks. Ad consumption occurs within a span of time that you define, called a consumption window. You can designate which ad breaks that MediaTailor fills with prefetch ads by setting avail matching criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchSchedule.Name
member.summary:

The name of the prefetch schedule. The name must be unique among all prefetch schedules that are associated with the specified playback configuration.

member.summary:

A complex type that contains settings for prefetch retrieval from the ad decision server (ADS).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PrefetchSchedule.StreamId
member.summary:

An optional stream identifier that you can specify in order to prefetch for multiple streams that use the same playback configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.Transition.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Defines when the program plays in the schedule. You can set the value to ABSOLUTE or RELATIVE.
ABSOLUTE - The program plays at a specific wall clock time. This setting can only be used for channels using the LINEAR PlaybackMode.
Note the following considerations when using ABSOLUTE transitions:
If the preceding program in the schedule has a duration that extends past the wall clock time, MediaTailor truncates the preceding program on a common segment boundary.
If there are gaps in playback, MediaTailor plays the FillerSlate you configured for your linear channel.
RELATIVE - The program is inserted into the schedule either before or after a program that you specify via RelativePosition.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.AmazonMediaTailorClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MediaTailor
Use the AWS Elemental MediaTailor SDKs and CLI to configure scalable ad insertion and linear channels. With MediaTailor, you can assemble existing content into a linear stream and serve targeted ads to viewers while maintaining broadcast quality in over-the-top (OTT) video applications. For information about using the service, including detailed information about the settings covered in this guide, see the AWS Elemental MediaTailor User Guide.
Through the SDKs and the CLI you manage AWS Elemental MediaTailor configurations and channels the same as you do through the console. For example, you specify ad insertion behavior and mapping information for the origin server and the ad decision server (ADS).

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaTailor.AmazonMediaTailorClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaTailorClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaTailor.IAmazonMediaTailor
member.summary:
Interface for accessing MediaTailor
Use the AWS Elemental MediaTailor SDKs and CLI to configure scalable ad insertion and linear channels. With MediaTailor, you can assemble existing content into a linear stream and serve targeted ads to viewers while maintaining broadcast quality in over-the-top (OTT) video applications. For information about using the service, including detailed information about the settings covered in this guide, see the AWS Elemental MediaTailor User Guide.
Through the SDKs and the CLI you manage AWS Elemental MediaTailor configurations and channels the same as you do through the console. For example, you specify ad insertion behavior and mapping information for the origin server and the ad decision server (ADS).
